result.execSummary:
The defendant Montreal D Treadway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (32 pages) commencing MAY 4, 2016 received and filed.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 686
cf

Defendant Montreal D Treadway in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Defendant Montreal D Treadway in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, Jazmine T., Kyeshia T., defense counsel and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  84 months, consecutive to any other sentence, with  762  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  42 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  42 months.  

As to Count 5:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  84 months, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 1 -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  42 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  42 months.  

As to Count 6:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  84 months, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 5  -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  42 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  42 months.  

Court finds defendant IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and  IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program - eligibility for both after 2 and 1/2 years of the initial confinement has been served.

-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $3,353

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $3,353 to Leonora S-M during the term of extended supervision.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  No Contact Order with the victims:  TeAmari P., Leonora S-M., Monica B., Kristen W., AND/OR  Alicia D. 
-  No Contact with the co-actor:  Trayshawn Norman
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms

Sentencing Memorandum and cover letter dated May 2, 2016 submitted by defense counsel - received and filed.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court sets bail at $10,000 cash

Defendant Montreal D Treadway in court with Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Defendant Montreal D Treadway in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Counts 1, 5 and 6:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as to the three counts as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Counts 2 and 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Counts 2 and 3   DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
